Redwood_City.Davey Glen Park: Davey Glen Park is a 1-acre (4,000 m2) piece of parkland set aside by the city of Belmont, California, in 2000 as part of an upscale housing development nearby.     Park land donation or in-lieu fees are required, in this case, land was donated approximately valued at $450,000/- to the City of Belmont Parks department in 2000 by the developer so that a future park would be built on the site. The site is currently zoned for planned development, but the title is held by the city.
